title: Herman Daled
text:
Herman J. Daled (12 June 1930 – 8 November 2020) was a Belgian art collector and radiologist.
Career.
Located in <a href="Brussels">Brussels</a>, he specialized in the field of <a href="conceptual%20art">conceptual art</a>. He notably helped to promote the artistic career of <a href="Daniel%20Buren">Daniel Buren</a> and various other artists through the collection of their works.
In particular, Daled collected art with his wife, Nicole Daled-Verstraeten, in the 1960s. Their collections included works by Jacques Charlier, <a href="Richard%20Long%20%28artist%29">Richard Long</a>, <a href="Marcel%20Broodthaers">Marcel Broodthaers</a>, <a href="Niele%20Toroni">Niele Toroni</a>, <a href="On%20Kawara">On Kawara</a>, <a href="Dan%20Graham">Dan Graham</a>, <a href="James%20Lee%20Byars">James Lee Byars</a>, <a href="Sol%20LeWitt">Sol LeWitt</a>, and <a href="Vito%20Acconci">Vito Acconci</a>. In 2011, he sold part of his collection to the <a href="Museum%20of%20Modern%20Art">Museum of Modern Art</a>.
Daled has several books published, including "Rebondissements" and "Contrat de première cession d’œuvre". He also worked as a radiologist in the field of <a href="oncology">oncology</a>. He was influenced by <a href="Nobel%20Prize%20in%20Physiology%20or%20Medicine">Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine</a> winner <a href="Albert%20Claude">Albert Claude</a> to enter the field of art.
Herman Daled died in <a href="Ixelles">Ixelles</a> on 8 November 2020 at the age of 90.
